department_name: Kings County Department of Public Health - Division of Environmental Health Services

grading_system.description: Kings County conducts routine food facility inspections and makes inspection reports publicly available, but specific grading methodology not verified from official sources

inspection_details.frequency: All food and beverage facilities are inspected on a routine basis throughout the year
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Investigations of complaints about food service operations and reported cases of foodborne illness
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports are public records and available online. All retail food businesses are required by law to make a copy of their most recent inspection report available for review by interested parties on request

fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen fire suppression systems required by NFPA standards, semi-annual inspections by licensed technicians required
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual inspections required for commercial kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (Part 7 of California Health and Safety Code)
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level inspection authority - Kings County Division of Environmental Health Services conducts inspections
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Local fire safety ordinances in addition to state codes

confidence_notes: Verified department structure, inspection authority, public disclosure requirements, and regulatory framework. However, specific grading system methodology (letter grades, numerical scores, thresholds) not found on official county sources.
verification_notes: Need to contact Kings County Division of Environmental Health Services directly at (559) 584-1411 to verify specific grading methodology, score ranges, and inspection frequency schedules. Fire department contact available at blake.adney@co.kings.ca.us for hood system requirements.
